name: Energy Enhancement System
overview: A quiet, restorative lounge designed for deep rest. Many guests use EES to downshift from an ‘always-on’ day into a calm, reflective state—similar to meditation or a mindful nap.
whatItIs: A set of screens arranged to create a specific electromagnetic environment sometimes described as “bio-scalar fields.” We present EES strictly as a relaxation modality—no diagnosis, treatment, or promises of medical outcomes.
benefits: A deliberate break from screens and notifications
Pairs well with breathwork, meditation, or journaling
A gentle way to mark the transition from day to evening
Many guests report easier wind-down before bedtime
sessionFlow: Arrive a few minutes early; store your phone and settle in.
Set a simple intention (rest, breathing, gratitude, or quiet).
Recline with an optional eye mask and blanket; let the room be still.
Hydrate after the session and notice how you feel for the rest of the day.

howItWorks.summary: Guests often ask about the “why it feels so calm.” A commonly referenced idea is the Schumann Resonance (~7.83 Hz), which overlaps with relaxed Alpha/Theta brainwave ranges associated with meditative, pre-sleep states.
details: Alpha/Theta: Linked with relaxed, dreamy states—periods the body naturally favors for repair and integration.
Cellular charge: In simple terms, calm states support healthy cell-membrane potentials (often cited ~70–90 mV).
Why “Scalar”? Some describe anti-phase coherence—similar to noise-canceling, where opposite waves flatten a signal. The concept suggests the resulting field feels still and spacious.
howItWorks.plainLanguage: Think of a purpose-built quiet room: fewer distractions, gentle lighting, and permission to do nothing—so your system can exhale.

howToPrepare: Dress in comfortable, layered clothing (you might cool down as you relax).
Shoes off in the lounge—bring socks or slippers for comfort.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to unwind before your session.
Avoid heavy perfumes or oils (some guests are scent-sensitive).
Consider a simple intention you’d like to rest into.

notes: This is a general wellness session, not a medical therapy.
If you are pregnant or have implanted electronic devices, consult your clinician before new wellness practices.
If you feel lightheaded when standing after deep rest, pause and hydrate.

disclaimer: Wellness information is educational and not medical advice. Experiences vary.

media.title: Energy Enhancement System — What to expect

microCopy: Soft blankets, low light, and a true phone-free zone. Treat it like a mini-retreat for your nervous system.

faq.q: What might I feel during a session?
faq.a: Many guests feel warm, drowsy, or gently ‘floaty’. Others simply feel neutral but rested afterward. There’s no “right” experience—just give yourself permission to be still.

faq.q: How many sessions should I try?
faq.a: If you’re new, try 1–3 sessions over 1–2 weeks and notice how your body responds. Some people book regular sessions as part of a broader relaxation routine.

faq.q: Can I read or listen to music?
faq.a: You can, though many guests find the deepest rest by closing their eyes, slowing their breath, and letting the room be quiet.

faq.q: How exactly does this system work?
faq.a: A common reference is Earth’s Schumann Resonance (~7.83 Hz), which overlaps with relaxed Alpha/Theta brainwaves. People often associate these states with calmer mood and easier wind-down.
It comes from ideas about anti-phase coherence (think noise-canceling). The concept suggests oscillations are flattened, creating a field that feels still.

name: Red Light Therapy (Photobiomodulation)
overview: Non-ionizing red and near-infrared (NIR) light aimed at supporting cellular energy and local circulation in targeted areas.
whatItIs: Photobiomodulation (PBM) delivers light in the red/NIR window to cellular photoacceptors (e.g., cytochrome-c oxidase). Sessions are parameter-based (wavelength, intensity, distance, and time).
benefits: Convenient, time-boxed sessions with no downtime
Pairs well with mobility, recovery, or PT routines
Parameter-driven: we set distance and time for consistency
sessionFlow: Choose a target area (e.g., skin, joints, scalp).
Clean skin; remove makeup/sunscreen from the target area.
Position at a measured distance; 10–20 minutes under the panel.
howToPrepare: Arrive with clean, product-free skin on the target area.
For scalp sessions, avoid heavy hair products before treatment.
Bring any questions about photosensitivity (meds, conditions) so we can adjust safely.

helmet810.title: Near-Infrared Light Therapy Helmet (810 nm)
deviceSpecs: LED array: 256 NIR LEDs + 4 red indicator LEDs
Primary wavelength: 810 nm (not visible to the eye)
Fit: lightweight helmet for scalp/brain-adjacent exposure
why810: Penetration: can reach cortical structures through the skull (~3–4 cm in humans).
Optical window: relatively lower absorption by water/hemoglobin—often considered a NIR ‘sweet spot’.
Research footprint: 810 nm is widely studied alongside nearby wavelengths (e.g., 850 nm, 1070 nm).
mechanisms: Mitochondria: Cytochrome-c oxidase absorption can support ATP production.
Vascular: Nitric oxide (NO) signaling → local vasodilation and oxygenation.
Redox: Controlled ROS modulation that can nudge repair signaling.
Neuroinflammation: May shift microglia expression toward anti-inflammatory profiles.
Neurotrophic: Studies report BDNF upregulation supporting neuronal plasticity.
timeAndFrequency: Typical plans: 4–6 sessions/week for 4–12 weeks; each 6–30 minutes.
Acute protocols (e.g., early recovery): sometimes daily initially (per protocol guidance).

notes: Avoid direct light into the eyes; protective goggles are provided.
If you are photosensitive or take photosensitizing medications, are pregnant, in active cancer treatment, or recently had procedures, consult your clinician first.
Temporary warmth or pinkness of the skin in the target area can occur and typically resolves shortly after.

microCopy: We’ll help you choose panel vs. helmet, then dial in time and distance for your goal.

faq.q: Will I feel anything during red/NIR light?
faq.a: Most people feel gentle warmth. Some feel nothing during the session but notice the target area feels easier to move afterward.

faq.q: How close should I be to the panel?
faq.a: Distance affects intensity (irradiance). We’ll set a measured distance for consistency and note it in your plan.

faq.q: How long until I notice changes?
faq.a: Responses vary. Many protocols span several weeks. We recommend tracking how the target area feels and functions over time.

name: Hydrogen-Rich Water
overview: Chilled water infused with dissolved molecular hydrogen (H₂). Many guests enjoy it as a light, crisp add-on before or after sessions.
whatItIs: Prepared on site and served promptly. Early clinical research explores markers related to oxidative stress, fatigue, and select metabolic outcomes in specific contexts.
benefits: Light, crisp taste that’s easy to sip
Simple add-on before or after sessions
Served fresh to preserve dissolved H₂
sessionFlow: Enjoy before or after a session, or on its own.

mechanismSnapshot: Molecular hydrogen (H₂) dissolves in water and is being studied for redox-signaling effects.
Research explores potential modulation of oxidative stress and inflammation markers with mixed but growing findings.
bestUseTips: Fresh is best: dissolved H₂ slowly dissipates—drink soon after serving.
Chilled service supports palatability and retention.
If you track supplements or hydration, note H₂ water as part of your log.
storageAndPrep: Prepared in-house with a dedicated generator.
Poured and served promptly to help preserve dissolved H₂.

howToPrepare: No special prep needed—simply arrive hydrated.
If you follow a medical plan, log H₂ water alongside your usual hydration.

notes: Generally well-tolerated in studies to date.
Not a treatment for medical conditions; for medical care, consult your clinician.
If you have fluid restrictions or specific dietary guidance, follow your clinician’s advice.

microCopy: Served cold and fresh—best enjoyed soon after pouring.

faq.a: Clean and crisp—like chilled still water. The hydrogen itself is tasteless.
Anytime is fine. Many guests like it pre-session (to arrive refreshed) or post-session (to rehydrate).
No. Molecular hydrogen is dissolved but does not make the water fizzy.
